body: @BEPROnICT .NET Core doesn't support Windows Form. Are you using the [`AzureRM`](https://www.powershellgallery.com/packages/AzureRM/5.1.1) module or [`AzureRM.Netcore`](https://www.powershellgallery.com/packages/AzureRM.Netcore/0.9.1) module? The former is for Windows PowerShell (targeting full .NET framework), and the latter is for PowerShell Core (targeting .NET Core). Can you try the `AzureRM.Netcore` module and see if it works for you?

FYI 

AzureRM.Netcore modules works great for Windows PSCore6 and specially on Linux.  Although not all AzureRM modules are ported to *.Netcore, you can connect, build and manage AzureRM VM's the same way. 

Using the initial command "Add-AzureRmAccount" the first time will ask you to open the browser to authorize your device to connect. 

![azurenetcore_login_2018-01-30_15-44-02](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19892435/35645133-f7d4c6ac-0698-11e8-88af-eceb86e990c5.jpg)

After that, you can save to a json file (using the Save-AzureRmContext), you can automate the login connection using the Import-AzureRmContext for the subscription you are working. 

![azurenetcore_login_011_2018-01-30_15-44-02](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19892435/35645310-6c9d5f30-0699-11e8-99da-7444c4f429c4.jpg)

```
## Windows or Linux connection - one time only
Add-AzureRmAccount;
:
## Add resource group, create Azure Storage,..
:

## - Save changes to AzureRMProfile: example Linux
Save-AzureRmContext -Path "/home/user01/AzureSubscriptions/AsubRMprofile.json";
:

## - From now on connect to Azure (not using Add-AzureRmAccount): 
## - To Login using the JSON profile: example Linux
Import-AzureRmContext -Path "/home/user01/AzureSubscriptions/lx_AsubRMprofile.json";
:
```
:)
